verses.verse: Surely <S%H3426><s%> there is a vein <S%H4161><s%> for the silver <S%H3701><s%>, and a place <S%H4725><s%> for gold <S%H2091><s%> where they fine <S%H2212><s%> it.
Iron <S%H1270><s%> is taken <S%H3947><s%> out of the earth <S%H6083><s%>, and brass <S%H5154><s%> is molten <S%H6694><s%> out of the stone <S%H68><s%>.

He setteth <S%H7760><s%> an end <S%H7093><s%> to darkness <S%H2822><s%>, and searcheth out <S%H2713><s%> all perfection <S%H8503><s%>: the stones <S%H68><s%> of darkness <S%H652><s%>, and the shadow of death <S%H6757><s%>.

The flood <S%H5158><s%> breaketh out <S%H6555><s%> from the inhabitant <S%H1481><s%>; even the waters forgotten <S%H7911><s%> of the foot <S%H7272><s%>: they are dried up <S%H1809><s%>, they are gone away <S%H5128><s%> from men <S%H582><s%>.
As for the earth <S%H776><s%>, out of it cometh <S%H3318><s%> bread <S%H3899><s%>: and under it is turned up <S%H2015><s%> as it were fire <S%H784><s%>.
The stones <S%H68><s%> of it are the place <S%H4725><s%> of sapphires <S%H5601><s%>: and it hath dust <S%H6083><s%> of gold <S%H2091><s%>.
There is a path <S%H5410><s%> which no fowl <S%H5861><s%> knoweth <S%H3045><s%>, and which the vulture's <S%H344><s%> eye <S%H5869><s%> hath not seen <S%H7805><s%>:
The lion's <S%H7830><s%> whelps <S%H1121><s%> have not trodden <S%H1869><s%> it, nor the fierce lion <S%H7826><s%> passed <S%H5710><s%> by it.
He putteth forth <S%H7971><s%> his hand <S%H3027><s%> upon the rock <S%H2496><s%>; he overturneth <S%H2015><s%> the mountains <S%H2022><s%> by the roots <S%H8328><s%>.
He cutteth out <S%H1234><s%> rivers <S%H2975><s%> among the rocks <S%H6697><s%>; and his eye <S%H5869><s%> seeth <S%H7200><s%> every precious thing <S%H3366><s%>.
He bindeth <S%H2280><s%> the floods <S%H5104><s%> from overflowing <S%H1065><s%>; and the thing that is hid <S%H8587><s%> bringeth he forth <S%H3318><s%> to light <S%H216><s%>.
But where <S%H370><s%> shall wisdom <S%H2451><s%> be found <S%H4672><s%>? and where is the place <S%H4725><s%> of understanding <S%H998><s%>?
Man <S%H582><s%> knoweth <S%H3045><s%> not the price <S%H6187><s%> thereof; neither is it found <S%H4672><s%> in the land <S%H776><s%> of the living <S%H2416><s%>.
The depth <S%H8415><s%> saith <S%H559><s%>, It is not in me: and the sea <S%H3220><s%> saith <S%H559><s%>, It is not with me.
It cannot be gotten <S%H5414><s%> for gold <S%H5458><s%>, neither shall silver <S%H3701><s%> be weighed <S%H8254><s%> for the price <S%H4242><s%> thereof.
It cannot be valued <S%H5541><s%> with the gold <S%H3800><s%> of Ophir <S%H211><s%>, with the precious <S%H3368><s%> onyx <S%H7718><s%>, or the sapphire <S%H5601><s%>.
The gold <S%H2091><s%> and the crystal <S%H2137><s%> cannot equal <S%H6186><s%> it: and the exchange <S%H8545><s%> of it shall not be for jewels <S%H3627><s%> of fine gold <S%H6337><s%>.
No mention <S%H2142><s%> shall be made of coral <S%H7215><s%>, or of pearls <S%H1378><s%>: for the price <S%H4901><s%> of wisdom <S%H2451><s%> is above rubies <S%H6443><s%>.
The topaz <S%H6357><s%> of Ethiopia <S%H3568><s%> shall not equal <S%H6186><s%> it, neither shall it be valued <S%H5541><s%> with pure <S%H2889><s%> gold <S%H3800><s%>.
Whence <S%H370><s%> then cometh <S%H935><s%> wisdom <S%H2451><s%>? and where is the place <S%H4725><s%> of understanding <S%H998><s%>?
Seeing it is hid <S%H5956><s%> from the eyes <S%H5869><s%> of all living <S%H2416><s%>, and kept close <S%H5641><s%> from the fowls <S%H5775><s%> of the air <S%H8064><s%>.
Destruction <S%H11><s%> and death <S%H4194><s%> say <S%H559><s%>, We have heard <S%H8085><s%> the fame <S%H8088><s%> thereof with our ears <S%H241><s%>.
God <S%H430><s%> understandeth <S%H995><s%> the way <S%H1870><s%> thereof, and he knoweth <S%H3045><s%> the place <S%H4725><s%> thereof.
For he looketh <S%H5027><s%> to the ends <S%H7098><s%> of the earth <S%H776><s%>, and seeth <S%H7200><s%> under the whole heaven <S%H8064><s%>;
To make <S%H6213><s%> the weight <S%H4948><s%> for the winds <S%H7307><s%>; and he weigheth <S%H8505><s%> the waters <S%H4325><s%> by measure <S%H4060><s%>.
When he made <S%H6213><s%> a decree <S%H2706><s%> for the rain <S%H4306><s%>, and a way <S%H1870><s%> for the lightning <S%H2385><s%> of the thunder <S%H6963><s%>:
Then did he see <S%H7200><s%> it, and declare <S%H5608><s%> it; he prepared <S%H3559><s%> it, yea, and searched it out <S%H2713><s%>.

And unto man <S%H120><s%> he said <S%H559><s%>, Behold, the fear <S%H3374><s%> of the Lord <S%H136><s%>, that is wisdom <S%H2451><s%>; and to depart <S%H5493><s%> from evil <S%H7451><s%> is understanding <S%H998><s%>.
